result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Randall Shultz

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Jason Randall Shultz in court, in custody. Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jason Randall Shultz. Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status in early December, defendant will be released to treatment today. Court accepts pleas of not guilty. State is in agreement to another status. Court reporter's zoom audio was not connected when the original hearing took place, Court goes back on the record to make a record of the arraignment with court reporter.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with law enforcement
Stip and Order of Modify Defendant's Bail Conditions
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact with law enforcement

3:01 PM Defendant Jason Randall Shultz appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ryan Reid appears in Court for Defendant.   Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Address updated. Attorney Reid acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty., asks for preliminary hearing. Court accepts pleas
State requests $3,000 cash bond, no violent or assaultive behaviour. Cites priors.
Attorney Reid. Dated FTA's. Asks for signature bond, or lower cash bond.
Court orders $3,000 cash with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with law enforcement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.
